text: Polygyny in animals is a mating system in which one male lives and mates with more than one female. Each female only mates with a single male. If several females mate with several males it is either as promiscuity or polygynandry. Typical polygyny is one-male, multi-female groups. The system is widespread. Examples are elephant seal,de Bruyn P.J.N.; Tosh C.A.; Bester, M.N.; Cameron E.Z.; McIntyre T.; Wilkinson I.S. 2011. Sex at sea: alternative mating system in an extremely polygynous mammal (PDF). Animal Behaviour. 82 (3): 445â€“451. spotted hyena,Holekamp, Kay E. et al. 2012. Society, demography and genetic structure in the spotted hyena. Molecular Ecology 21.3 (2012): 613-632. gorilla, house wren, hamadryas baboon, common pheasant, red deer, Bengal tiger. == References == Category:Ethology Category:Sexuality
title: Polygyny in animals
